moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4 Nf6: This variation has been called the Neo-Steinitz.
moves.6. d4 b5 7. dxe5 dxe5 8. Qxd8+ Nxd8 9. B: The sacrifice of the exchange for 2 pawns is excellent.
If indeed 21...R3xa6 so 22 Rxa6 Rxa6  23 Bxe6+ Ke7 and White has 2 knights and 1 pawn for the rook.
moves.24. Ra4: Everyone is being put to work.
moves.24... Rb6 25. c3 c6 26. b4 Ne6 27. Nb3 N: Black is helpless; his Queen side is all tied up.
moves.33. Nb7 Ne8 34. Nb3a5 Rc8 35. Rd1 Bb8 36: The game was adjourned here and adjudicated a win for White by International Grandmaster Isaac Kasden.  Indeed, there is no hope for Black.  Dr. Lasker conducted 2 more consultation games at the same time.  He was 70 years old in 1938.

players: Dr. Emanual Lasker  vs. Denker, Philips & Platz
opening: Ruy Lopez (C79), Steinitz defence deferred (Russian defence)
